snippet: Seconds before a Southwest Airlines flight hit the runway nose wheel-first at La Guardia Airport on July 22, the captain of the plane took control from the first officer, the National Transportation Safety Board said.
lead_paragraph: Seconds before a Southwest Airlines flight hit the runway nose wheel-first at La Guardia Airport on July 22, the captain of the plane took control from the first officer, the National Transportation Safety Board said.

headline.main: Pilots Switched Controlling Before a Rough Landing
headline.print_headline: Pilots Switched Controlling Before a Rough Landing
